alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 3:55AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Runoff will lead to minor flooding along the North Branch of the Park River in Hartford through 515 AM EST... At 355 AM EST, River gauge at North Branch of the Park River reports river level of 7.15 feet and continues to rise. Minor flood stage is 8.0 feet. The river level may continue to rise during the next 1 to 2 hours, creating minor flooding. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...In addition to minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. At 8.0 feet lowland flooding will occur along the North Branch of the Park River. Portions of the University of Hartford campus parking lots along the river will become flooded. Action must be taken now to protect cars in these lots. Never try to cross a flooded roadway as the roadway may be damaged or washed out. Locations impacted include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, East Hartford, Glastonbury, Newington, Windsor, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Avon, Suffield, Windsor Locks, Granby, and East Granby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
